sen.j: 地下家伝（じげかでん：地下家傳）は、江戸時代後期の天保に成立した、地下人諸家の系図をまとめた歴史書。
sen.e: The Jige Kaden, a work of history written during the Tenpo era in the late Edo period, is a collection of the genealogical records of families of Jigenin (low-ranking court officials who were not allowed into the Emperor's living quarters in the imperial palace, usually ranked at the sixth rank or lower except for Kurodo).

The Jige Kaden, a work of history written during the Tenpo era in the late Edo period, is a collection of the genealogical records of families of Jigenin (low-ranking court officials who were not allowed into the Emperor's living quarters in the imperial palace, usually ranked at the sixth rank or lower except for Kurodo).

The Jige Kaden, a work of history written during the Tenpo era in the late Edo period, is a collection of the genealogical records of families of Jigenin (low-ranking court officials who were not allowed into the Emperor's living quarters in the imperial palace, usually ranked at the sixth rank or lower except for Kurodo).

sen.j: 編者は北面武士であった三上景文。
sen.e: The editor was Kagefumi MIKAMI, a member of the Hokumen warriors (guards of the north side of the Imperial palace).
The editor was Kagefumi MIKAMI, a member of the Hokumen warriors (guards of the north side of the Imperial palace).
The editor was Kagefumi MIKAMI, a member of the Hokumen warriors (guards of the north side of the Imperial palace).
Background of the Work's Composition
Background of the Work's Composition
Background of the Work's Composition

sen.j: 景文が生きた時代は、律令制が有名無実化し公家の家格が堂上家と地下家に分離してから、すでに数百年が経過していた。
sen.e: By the period Kagefumi lived in, several hundred years had already passed since the Ritsuryo system had become nothing but a name and the noble families of the court had been divided by status into the Tosho-ke (the lineage of court nobles occupying relatively high ranks) and the Jige-ke.

By the period Kagefumi lived in, several hundred years had already passed since the Ritsuryo system had become nothing but a name and the noble families of the court had been divided by status into the Tosho-ke (the lineage of court nobles occupying relatively high ranks) and the Jige-ke.

By the period Kagefumi lived in, several hundred years had already passed since the Ritsuryo system had become nothing but a name and the noble families of the court had been divided by status into the Tosho-ke (the lineage of court nobles occupying relatively high ranks) and the Jige-ke.

sen.j: 身分の高い堂上家は、その出自や歴代当主の生没年、および叙位の履歴などを詳細に記録してきた。
sen.e: The high-ranking Tosho-ke families had detailed records of their origins, the dates of birth and death of their successive heads, and the history of their investiture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The high-ranking Tosho-ke families had detailed records of their origins, the dates of birth and death of their successive heads, and the history of their investiture.
The high-ranking Tosho-ke families had detailed records of their origins, the dates of birth and death of their successive heads, and the history of their investiture.

sen.j: が、実務官僚ともいうべき地下家には、そのような立派な系図の残っている例はきわめて希であった。
sen.e: But among the Jige-ke, who were more like actual administrative officers, few families kept such grand genealogies.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: But among the Jige-ke, who were more like actual administrative officers, few families kept such grand genealogies.
But among the Jige-ke, who were more like actual administrative officers, few families kept such grand genealogies.

sen.j: また、地下家には、在野の者が何らかの功績が認められて官位を与えられ、新家として新たに地下の身分を与えられるものも多かった。
sen.e: In addition, there were many Jige-ke families who had originally been outside the circles of power, but were promoted out of recognition for their contributions and newly given the status of Jige as new families.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, there were many Jige-ke families who had originally been outside the circles of power, but were promoted out of recognition for their contributions and newly given the status of Jige as new families.

In addition, there were many Jige-ke families who had originally been outside the circles of power, but were promoted out of recognition for their contributions and newly given the status of Jige as new families.

sen.j: そのためか、この当時に地下であった家は、ほとんどがその出自・来歴の判らない状態であった。
sen.e: This might be the reason that most of the Jige-ke families in those days were unclear about their origins and histories.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This might be the reason that most of the Jige-ke families in those days were unclear about their origins and histories.
This might be the reason that most of the Jige-ke families in those days were unclear about their origins and histories.

sen.j: これを嘆いた景文は、独自に地下諸家の系譜調査を開始する。
sen.e: Bemoaning this fact, Kagefumi started an independent survey of the various Jige-ke families' lineages.
Bemoaning this fact, Kagefumi started an independent survey of the various Jige-ke families' lineages.
Bemoaning this fact, Kagefumi started an independent survey of the various Jige-ke families' lineages.

sen.j: どのような方法で資料の収集を行ったのかは不明である。
sen.e: His method of collecting the necessary sources is unknown.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His method of collecting the necessary sources is unknown.
His method of collecting the necessary sources is unknown.

sen.j: おそらく、各家に依頼し、その家に伝わる家系図や口宣案（位階官職の辞令）などの提供を受けたものと推測される。
sen.e: It is assumed that possibly, in response to his request, the Jige-families offered their family trees and the kuzenan (official announcements of appointment) that had been handed down from generation to generation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is assumed that possibly, in response to his request, the Jige-families offered their family trees and the kuzenan (official announcements of appointment) that had been handed down from generation to generation.

It is assumed that possibly, in response to his request, the Jige-families offered their family trees and the kuzenan (official announcements of appointment) that had been handed down from generation to generation.

sen.j: こうして集められた資料を基に、景文は天保13年9月（1842年10月）に執筆を開始した。
sen.e: Based on such materials collected in this way, Kagefumi started writing in October 1842.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Based on such materials collected in this way, Kagefumi started writing in October 1842.
Based on such materials collected in this way, Kagefumi started writing in October 1842.

sen.j: 1年半後の天保15年5月1日 (旧暦)（1844年6月16日）に初版が完成した。
sen.e: After a year and a half, the first edition was completed on June 16, 1844.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After a year and a half, the first edition was completed on June 16, 1844.
After a year and a half, the first edition was completed on June 16, 1844.
Publication by Atsuo MASAMUNE
Publication by Atsuo MASAMUNE
Publication by Atsuo MASAMUNE

sen.j: 地下家伝は初版成立後、数回の改定・補遺を経て安政年間に最後の改訂が行われている。
sen.e: After the first edition was published, the Jige Kaden was revised and supplemented several times, and the last revision was performed during the Ansei era.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the first edition was published, the Jige Kaden was revised and supplemented several times, and the last revision was performed during the Ansei era.
After the first edition was published, the Jige Kaden was revised and supplemented several times, and the last revision was performed during the Ansei era.

sen.j: そう多くはないが写本が発行されている。
sen.e: Although not many, some manuscripts were made.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although not many, some manuscripts were made.
Although not many, some manuscripts were made.

sen.j: ただし、印刷ではなく毛筆によって写本されたため、写稿を重ねるごとに誤字や欠落、巻構成の誤差が生じた。
sen.e: However, they were not printed but copied by hand using a brush, and the more the book was copied, the more clerical errors, omissions, and errors in the structure of volumes were produced.
However, they were not printed but copied by hand using a brush, and the more the book was copied, the more clerical errors, omissions, and errors in the structure of volumes were produced.
However, they were not printed but copied by hand using a brush, and the more the book was copied, the more clerical errors, omissions, and errors in the structure of volumes were produced.

sen.j: 昭和13年（1938年）、国文学者の正宗敦夫がその当時残存していた写本を編集して出版した。
sen.e: In 1938, Atsuo MASAMUNE, a scholar of Japanese literature, edited the manuscripts surviving at the time and published them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1938, Atsuo MASAMUNE, a scholar of Japanese literature, edited the manuscripts surviving at the time and published them.
In 1938, Atsuo MASAMUNE, a scholar of Japanese literature, edited the manuscripts surviving at the time and published them.

sen.j: が、参考にした複数の写本の間にも文字の違いや巻構成の違いが見られた。
sen.e: Still, among the several manuscripts he used for reference, there were some differences in the characters and the structure of volumes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Still, among the several manuscripts he used for reference, there were some differences in the characters and the structure of volumes.
Still, among the several manuscripts he used for reference, there were some differences in the characters and the structure of volumes.

sen.j: 正宗版の地下家伝で第31巻が欠番とされたのはそのためである。
sen.e: This was the reason for Masamune labeling the 31st volume of the Jige Kaden as missing.
This was the reason for Masamune labeling the 31st volume of the Jige Kaden as missing.
This was the reason for Masamune labeling the 31st volume of the Jige Kaden as missing.

sen.j: また、安政以降改定がなされなかったため、最後の改訂から明治維新で地下という身分が消滅した時点までの当主が判らないという欠点もある。
sen.e: It also has the defect that because it was not revised after the Ansei era, it cannot identify the heads during the period from the last revision to the Meiji Restoration, when the status of Jige was discontinued.

It also has the defect that because it was not revised after the Ansei era, it cannot identify the heads during the period from the last revision to the Meiji Restoration, when the status of Jige was discontinued.

It also has the defect that because it was not revised after the Ansei era, it cannot identify the heads during the period from the last revision to the Meiji Restoration, when the status of Jige was discontinued.

sen.j: ただ、景文の記した原本やそれに限りなく近い写本が発見されていない。
sen.e: However, neither the original text written by Kagefumi himself nor any manuscript essentially identical to it has been found yet.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, neither the original text written by Kagefumi himself nor any manuscript essentially identical to it has been found yet.
However, neither the original text written by Kagefumi himself nor any manuscript essentially identical to it has been found yet.

sen.j: また正宗自身も故人となった現在では、正宗版より正確な地下家伝の出版はまず期待できない。
sen.e: Besides, now that Masamune himself has already passed away, another edition of the Jige Kaden more accurate than Masamune's edition is unlikely to be published.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Besides, now that Masamune himself has already passed away, another edition of the Jige Kaden more accurate than Masamune's edition is unlikely to be published.
Besides, now that Masamune himself has already passed away, another edition of the Jige Kaden more accurate than Masamune's edition is unlikely to be published.

sen.j: しかし、地下家の系譜に関してこれほどまでに綿密かつ詳細に調査したものは他に存在しない。
sen.e: And yet there is nothing else that has surveyed the genealogical record of the Jige-ke families so carefully or in such detail.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: And yet there is nothing else that has surveyed the genealogical record of the Jige-ke families so carefully or in such detail.
And yet there is nothing else that has surveyed the genealogical record of the Jige-ke families so carefully or in such detail.

sen.j: そのため、現代では地下諸家の研究や調査において、地下家伝は欠かす事のできない史料となっている。
sen.e: For this reason, now the Jige Kaden is an indispensable historical source for the study and research of Jige-ke families.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For this reason, now the Jige Kaden is an indispensable historical source for the study and research of Jige-ke families.
For this reason, now the Jige Kaden is an indispensable historical source for the study and research of Jige-ke families.
Contents
Contents
Contents

sen.j: 地下家伝は、所属する官庁や摂家、宮家、門跡などの別に全33巻に分けられている。
sen.e: The Jige Kaden has 33 volumes in total, divided according to categories such as the offices they held, and the differences between Sekke (families of the regent line), Miyake (families allowed to have the status of the Imperial family) and Monzeki (families from temples of high rank where members of imperial family and nobility had entered the priesthood).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Jige Kaden has 33 volumes in total, divided according to categories such as the offices they held, and the differences between Sekke (families of the regent line), Miyake (families allowed to have the status of the Imperial family) and Monzeki (families from temples of high rank where members of imperial family and nobility had entered the priesthood).

The Jige Kaden has 33 volumes in total, divided according to categories such as the offices they held, and the differences between Sekke (families of the regent line), Miyake (families allowed to have the status of the Imperial family) and Monzeki (families from temples of high rank where members of imperial family and nobility had entered the priesthood).

sen.j: 地下諸家の歴代当主の名前、父母の名、生没年月日、叙位・任官の履歴等を可能な限り記載している。
sen.e: It records, in as much detail as possible, such things as the names of the successive heads of Jige-ke families, the names of their fathers and mothers, the dates of their birth and death, and the history of their investitures and appointments to office.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It records, in as much detail as possible, such things as the names of the successive heads of Jige-ke families, the names of their fathers and mothers, the dates of their birth and death, and the history of their investitures and appointments to office.

It records, in as much detail as possible, such things as the names of the successive heads of Jige-ke families, the names of their fathers and mothers, the dates of their birth and death, and the history of their investitures and appointments to office.

sen.j: 正宗版によれば、各巻の構成は下記の通り。
sen.e: According to the Masamune edition, the configuration of the volumes is as follows;
According to the Masamune edition, the configuration of the volumes is as follows;

sen.cmt: 原文中「御蔵」について、調べましたが読み、役職の内容ともに判明せず、漢字のまま残しています。
